body_html:
@sanjoy It is clear that llvm.BUILD is generated by a script, but is updating of this BUILD file also fully automated by the script as well (zero manual editing)?

The llvm.BUILD generator does not require any manual editing -- it always generates a fully formed llvm.BUILD. However, we have to run it manually when there is some structural change in LLVM (for instance if a component is split into two).
body_text:
@sanjoy It is clear that llvm.BUILD is generated by a script, but is updating of this BUILD file also fully automated by the script as well (zero manual editing)?

The llvm.BUILD generator does not require any manual editing -- it always generates a fully formed llvm.BUILD.  However, we have to run it manually when there is some structural change in LLVM (for instance if a component is split into two).
body:
> @sanjoy It is clear that llvm.BUILD is generated by a script, but is updating of this BUILD file also fully automated by the script as well (zero manual editing)?

The llvm.BUILD generator does not require any manual editing -- it always generates a fully formed llvm.BUILD.  However, we have to _run_ it manually when there is some structural change in LLVM (for instance if a component is split into two).
